title: Cowpen Bewley Woodland Park - Billingham Walk Route

images.title: Mick Garratt / Cowpen Bewley Woodland Country Park
images.caption: Pond at the site

images.title: peter robinson / Visitor Centre Cowpen Bewley Woodland Park
images.caption: Visitor Centre Cowpen Bewley Woodland Park. The park also includes wildflower meadows, wetland areas and a lake.

images.title: Carol Rose / "The towers are tall...."
images.caption: Inscribed stone. "The towers are tall...." The park is peppered with carved stones bearing poetic quotes from local people.

images.title: Mick Garratt / Seat, Cowpen Bewley Woodland Country Park
images.caption: Seat. Built in brick in recognition of the brickworks that originally stood on this land.

images.title: Carol Rose / Across the wildflower meadow towards the pylons
images.caption: Across the wildflower meadow towards the pylons

description: This country park in Billingham is the perfect place for a peaceful afternoon stroll. The park consists of grassland, a lake, a series of ponds and a beck flows which around the boundary of the park. The lake is fantastic for birdwatching - look out for coot, pochard, swans, grebes, herons and the tufted duck. For cyclists National Cycle Route 14 runs through the park. Just to the west of the park you will find Wynyard Woodland Park which is a great place to extend your woodland walking. Head south west and you can visit Coatham Woods where there's more nice trails and wildlife to see.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a nice on site cafe where you can enjoy rest and refreshment after your exercise.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The parkland and woodland are ideal for a dog walk. There are off lead and on lead areas because of the wildlife. It's a popular place for dog walkers so you'll probably meet other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just two miles to the south west there's Billingham Beck Valley Country Park to explore. There's a visitor centre and pleasant nature trails along the pretty Billingham Beck to be found at this wildlife rich site.

display_address: Seal Sands Road, Cowpen Bewley, Billingham, Stockton-on-Tees, Tees Valley, England, TS23 3LT, United Kingdom
